narratives.question_text: How clearly did the instructor define the topic of study?
comments: Taken together, the syllabus and the textbook clearly defined the topic.

narratives.question_text: How clearly did the instructor outline the expectation for the course, classroom activity and homework?
How well were individual class sessions prepared and presented?
comments: Erich was always prepared for class, whether the focus was a lab or a lecture. He was also flexible and able to adapt to unexpected changes such as the snow day.

Great at explanations and giving examples, but sometimes gives too many examples and restates things a lot. Its hard to stay focused when the course moves too slowly, just as it would be if the course moved too fast. I think the pace is pretty good, though.

narratives.question_text: How well did lectures fit within the boundaries of the course?

comments: The workload was both appropriate and was evenly distributed throughout the semester.

narratives.question_text: How available was the instructor for help outside the classroom?
comments: Erich is always available for help and answers.

narratives.question_text: How useful were assignments in furthering an understanding of the topic?
comments: The final project gave me a much better understanding of the software we'd discussed throughout the semester than I could've possibly gotten from lectures alone.

narratives.question_text: If tests were given, how fairly did they measure knowledge gained?
comments: I'm not entirely sure how well the midterm measured the knowledge I gained throughout the first half of the semester because we never got our grades back and never took time to discuss it.

It was a fair test, but it came up suddenly and surprised everyone. Maybe if there were more verbal questions asked to the class to check understanding at beginning or end of lectures, it would be more apparent (to students) that the knowledge hadn't sank in.

narratives.question_text: How useful was this course in preparing you for production work?
comments: This class did a great job at relating classwork to potential jobstacles - thats a new word that i just created.
I'm no expert, but I would be a little more comfortable using this technology in the future.

narratives.question_text: How would you evaluate the instructor's knowledge of the material?
comments: Erich definitely knows what he's talking about. Sometimes, it's hard for him to "dumb it down" for people with little to no prior experience in control systems, but he manages.

narratives.question_text: Please offer additional comments on such topics as: what worked best about the course, suggested improvements, class materials, etc.
comments: I loved how well we got to learn medialon. I would recommend to spend a little time (maybe a project or two) on Qlab. I know it doesnt have inputs but i can see that QL would get used quite a bit in the industry and it would be nice to know it a little better.
I think this class could benefit from having a TA. During lab sessions and in-class work on the final project, Erich was pulled in too many directions by all the people who needed him.

Just periodic check ins in the form of questions would be more helpful for me personally... it's one thing to listen to a lecture, but it's much more engaging when there are questions asked and you realize if you know (or don't know) what we are talking about.
